alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 09 at 11:42AM AKST until February 10 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: .Conditions have warmed with not as much snow for locations around Pelican and Hyder. The first band of snow moved through the area with 1 to 5 inches being reported and is now over the far northern inner channels. Another band of enhanced precipitation is currently over the central panhandle and is in the process of moving north. This area of enhanced precipitation will begin to affect the northern inner channels again later this afternoon with snow persisting overnight before the entire system moves to the east. The placement of this enhancement could affect amounts along with temperatures being near or just above freezing. ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM AKST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 9 inches. * WHERE...Icy Strait corridor and the City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 AM AKST Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Wet heavy snow will be difficult to move. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will move back into the area this afternoon and evening as a stronger band of heavier snow will move into the area from the south. Some mixing with rain is possible at times. Snowfall reports so far have been from 2 to 5 inches with the most in the Hoonah area.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling.

area.areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay
